exerelin_abilities.followMeTooltip2: Only works on patrol, strike and defense fleets, and the fleet must have seen you with your transponder on.

exerelin_alliances.intelDescPeaceNo: The alliance $alliance has voted against making peace with $theOtherParty.

exerelin_alliances.numAlliances: There are $numAlliances alliance(s) in the Sector

nex_agents.intelDescLost: Operative $name has been captured or killed.
nex_agents.intelDescDismissed: Operative $name has been dismissed from your service.
nex_agents.intelDescLocation: $name is currently $onOrAt $market, a $faction market in the $location.
nex_agents.intelDescLocationHyper: $name is currently $onOrAt $market, a $faction market in hyperspace.
nex_agents.intelButtonCellKillTooltip:
When operative is idle, will periodically travel to player or commissioning faction colonies with Pather cells, and destroy them. Will also find unlocated pirate bases if no relevant cells exist.

Should only be used on one operative at a time, as nothing prevents multiple operatives from trying to remove the same cell.
nex_agents.intelButtonRepeatRelationsTooltip: After completing a raise/lower relations action, repeat it until reaching the maximum effect or ordered to abort (or you run out of money).
nex_agents.intelDescLocalReport1: %s is a size %s market, of stability %s.
nex_agents.intelDescLocalReport2: Space patrol strength: %s, ground defence strength: %s
nex_agents.intelDescLocalReport4: Predicted income under player control: $net ($income income, $expenses expenses)
nex_agents.intelPromptUnlockMastery: Freed from the constraints of specialization, a Master-level operative can perform any action type.
nex_agents.intelPromptAbort: Aborting the mission now will refund %s credits. Proceed?
nex_agents.intelPromptAbortQueued: Cancelling the queued mission will refund %s credits. Proceed?
nex_agents.intelPromptRepeat: Repeating action %s will cost %s credits. You have %s credits. Proceed?
nex_agents.intelPromptRepeatNotEnoughCredits: Repeating action %s will cost %s credits. You only have %s credits.
nex_agents.barPrompt: A shady-looking $manOrWoman is sitting in a corner of the bar. $HeOrShe gives you an appraising look.
nex_agents.barOptionStart: Walk over to the shady person
nex_agents.barDialogIntro1: You approach the shady figure, who acknowledges you with a nod.
nex_agents.barDialogIntro2: "Figured you'd notice me eventually. I don't suppose you know what I do?"
nex_agents.barDialogExplanation: "I'm a $manOrWoman of many tricks, shall we say. I can sniff out a Pather in a crowd at forty paces, or assassinate the governor of a colony, or even take down a core world's spaceport if the odds are right. I think an enterprising starfarer like you will have no problem finding a use for such... talents."
nex_agents.barDialogExplanationNegotiator: "Ever wanted to win friends and influence people? I can do that on your behalf. Lobby a few planetary officials to take a more favorable view of your latest activities... or start a vicious libel campaign against someone you don't like. Maybe even persuade an entire planetary population to rise in revolt."
nex_agents.barDialogExplanationSaboteur: "You want to watch a world burn, I'm your $manOrWoman. Torch someone's fully stocked warehouse of luxury goods? Cause chaos with a public shooting? Sabotage a planetary spaceport? I can do all that, with a little prep work and funding."
nex_agents.barDialogExplanationHybrid: "I've got a range of talents you might find useful. Whether it's under-the-table deals with a senator, exposing a nefarious Pather plot, or sending an organics storage tank up in flames, if something needs to be done untraceably, you've come to the right $manOrWoman."
nex_agents.barDialogPay: "I'll expect a %s credit hiring bonus, and afterwards a starting salary of %s credits per month. Once the initial transfer is complete, I'll be ready for directions within the hour."
"I'll expect a %s credit hiring bonus. Once the initial transfer is complete, I'll be ready for directions within the hour."
nex_agents.barOptionMaxAgents: "I can't hire any more operatives at the moment."
nex_agents.barOptionNotEnoughCredits: "I can't afford that at the moment."
nex_agents.barDialogHired: "Excellent." $HeOrShe slides a data chip across the table before getting up and leaving. "I'll be in touch."
nex_agents.barDialogHiredTip: You can find your newly hired operative in the Intel screen, using the Operatives tag.
nex_agents.tooltipSalary: Each operative receives a base salary of %s credits per month, plus %s credits per operative level.

nex_agentActions.intelDesc_raiseRelations_success: An operative from $theAgentFaction has subverted the $faction political process to improve relations with their own faction.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_raiseRelations_successPlayer: Your operative $agentName has successfully subverted the $faction political process to improve relations with $theThirdFaction.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_raiseRelations_failure: An operative from $theAgentFaction failed to subvert the $faction political process to improve relations with their own faction. Fortunately, their attempts at manipulation went unnoticed.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_raiseRelations_failurePlayer: Your operative $agentName failed to subvert the $faction political process to improve relations with $theThirdFaction. Fortunately, their attempts at manipulation went undetected.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_raiseRelations_failureDetected: An operative from $theAgentFaction was discovered attempting to manipulate the $faction political process to improve relations with their own faction. Instead, their meddling has caused the opposite effect.
Your operative $agentName was discovered attempting to manipulate the $faction political process to improve relations with $theThirdFaction. They are not amused.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_lowerRelations_success: An operative from $theAgentFaction has subverted the $faction political process to turn it against $theThirdFaction.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_lowerRelations_successPlayer: Your operative $agentName has subverted the $faction political process to turn it against $theThirdFaction.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_lowerRelations_failure: An operative from $theAgentFaction failed to subvert the $faction political process to turn it against $theThirdFaction. Fortunately, their attempts at manipulation went unnoticed.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_lowerRelations_failurePlayer: Your operative $agentName failed to subvert the $faction political process to turn it against $theThirdFaction. Fortunately, their attempts at manipulation went unnoticed.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_lowerRelations_failureDetected: An operative from $theAgentFaction was discovered attempting to manipulate the $faction political process to turn it against $theThirdFaction. Ironically, their actions have turned the two would-be enemies against their own faction instead.

Your operative $agentName was discovered attempting to manipulate the $faction political process to turn it against $theThirdFaction. $TheAgentFaction will not thank you for turning both factions against them.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_destabilizeMarket_success: An operative from $theAgentFaction has $actionLine $onOrAt $market. $Faction investigators are appealing to the public to come forward with information on the attack.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_destabilizeMarket_successPlaye: Your operative $agentName has $actionLine $onOrAt $market. $Faction investigators are appealing to the public to come forward with information on the attack.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_destabilizeMarket_successDetec: An operative from $theAgentFaction has $actionLine $onOrAt $market. $Faction authorities have found evidence of $agentFaction involvement.
Your operative $agentName has $actionLine $onOrAt $market. $Faction authorities have found evidence of $agentFaction involvement.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_destabilizeMarket_failure: An attempt by a $agentFaction operative to cause chaos $onOrAt $market has been thwarted. $Faction authorities have been unable to identify the party responsible, however.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_destabilizeMarket_failurePlaye: $Faction security has thwarted your operative $agentName's attempts to cause chaos $onOrAt $market. Fortunately, they have been unable to conclusively link you to the crime.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_destabilizeMarket_failureDetec: An $agentFaction operative was captured while attempting to destabilize $market. $Faction intelligence is reported to be planning reprisals.
Your operative $agentName was discovered while attempting to destabilize $market. $Faction intelligence is reported to be planning reprisals.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_sabotageIndustry_success: An operative from $theAgentFaction has sabotaged the $industry $onOrAt $market. $Faction investigators have no leads on the crime.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_sabotageIndustry_successPlayer: Your operative $agentName has sabotaged the $industry $onOrAt $market, and made it look like an accident.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_sabotageIndustry_successDetect: An operative from $theAgentFaction has sabotaged the $industry $onOrAt $market. $Faction authorities have found evidence of $agentFaction involvement.
Your operative $agentName has sabotaged the $industry $onOrAt $market. $Faction intelligence has traced the attack back to $theAgentFaction.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_sabotageIndustry_failure: An attempt by a $agentFaction operative to sabotage the $industry $onOrAt $market has been thwarted. $Faction authorities have been unable to identify the party responsible, however.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_sabotageIndustry_failurePlayer: $Faction security has thwarted your operative $agentName's attempt to sabotage the $industry $onOrAt $market. Fortunately, $theFaction has not been able to determine who was responsible.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_sabotageIndustry_failureDetect: An operative sent by the $agentFaction to sabotage the $industry $onOrAt $market was seized by authorities. $TheFaction is regarding this as a hostile act.
Your operative $agentName has been caught attempting to sabotage the $industry $onOrAt $market. $TheFaction is expected to respond forcefully.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_destroyCommodities_success: A $agentFaction operative has destroyed a stockpile of $commodity $onOrAt $market. $Faction investigators are finding themselves stumped.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_destroyCommodities_successPlay: Your operative $agentName has destroyed a stockpile of $commodity $onOrAt $market. $Faction authorities have their suspicions, but are unable to find any real evidence of $agentFaction involvement.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_destroyCommodities_successDete: A $agentFaction operative has destroyed a stockpile of $commodity $onOrAt $market. $Faction authorities accuse $theAgentFaction of the crime.
Your operative $agentName has destroyed a stockpile of $commodity $onOrAt $market. $Faction authorities have identified $theAgentFaction as responsible for the attack.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_destroyCommodities_failure: Attempts by an operative of $agentFaction to destroy $commodity stocked $onOrAt $market have failed. $Faction authorities have been unable to determine who was responsible, however.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_destroyCommodities_failurePlay: Your operative $agentName has failed in their attempt to $commodity stocked $onOrAt $market. Fortunately, $theFaction has not traced the crime back to $agentFaction.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_destroyCommodities_failureDete: An operative of $theAgentFaction was arrested by $faction authorities while attempting to destroy stocks of $commodity $onOrAt $market.
$TheFaction counterintelligence has stopped your $agentName in an attempt to destroy $commodity stockpiled $onOrAt $market.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_infiltrateCell_success: $AgentFaction intelligence has broken up a $faction cell on $market, a success cheered by the population.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_infiltrateCell_successPlayer: Your operative $agentName has infiltrated and broken up a $faction cell on $market. They won't be a problem any longer, at least for a while.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_infiltrateCell_failure: An $agentFaction operative has failed to penetrate a $faction cell on $market. Terrorist activity continues.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_infiltrateCell_failurePlayer: Your operative $agentName has failed to infiltrate a $faction cell on $market. They're fortunate to be alive — such cells have a short way with traitors.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_procureShip_success: A $agentFaction operative has arranged the illegal purchase of a $ship from $market. $Faction investigators have failed to detect the crime.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_procureShip_successPlayer: Your operative $agentName has 'bought' a $ship $onOrAt $market. $Faction authorities have not appeared to notice the disappearance.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_procureShip_successDetected: A $agentFaction operative has arranged the illegal purchase of a $ship from $market. $Faction have determined $theAgentFaction was responsible.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_procureShip_successDetectedPla: Your operative $agentName has 'bought' a $ship $onOrAt $market. $Faction authorities have identified $theAgentFaction involvement.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_procureShip_failure: An $agentFaction operative $onOrAt $market failed to illegally procure a $ship. $Faction investigators were unable to determine the responsible party.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_procureShip_failurePlayer: Your operative $agentName has failed to illegally procure a $ship $onOrAt $market. Fortunately, they were able to destroy evidence of $agentFaction responsibility.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_procureShip_failureDetected: An attempt by an operative of $theAgentFaction to illegally procure a $ship $orOnAt market was thwarted by by $faction authorities.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_procureShip_failureDetectedPla: $Faction authorities have stopped an attempt by $agentName to illegally procure a $ship $onOrAt $market. They will not be pleased with $theAgentFaction.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_instigateRebellion_success: A $agentFaction operative has instigated a rebellion $onOrAt $market. $Faction authorities have been taken by surprise.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_instigateRebellion_successPlay: Your operative $agentName has instigated a rebellion $onOrAt $market. $Faction authorities have not identified your involvement.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_instigateRebellion_successDete: A $agentFaction operative has instigated a rebellion $onOrAt $market. $TheFaction has taken umbrage at this hostile act.
Your operative $agentName has instigated a rebellion $onOrAt $market. $TheFaction has identified you as the rebels' backer.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_instigateRebellion_failure: An $agentFaction operative failed to instigate a rebellion $onOrAt $market. However, they concealed their faction's involvement.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_instigateRebellion_failurePlay: Your operative $agentName has failed to instigate a rebellion $onOrAt $market against $TheFaction. Fortunately, they managed to cover up your involvement.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_instigateRebellion_failureDete: $TheAgentFaction was thwarted in their attempt to instigate a rebellion $onOrAt $market. $TheFaction is certainly planning reprisals.
$Faction authorities have broken up $agentName's attempted rebellion $onOrAt $market. They will not overlook $theAgentFaction's crime.
nex_agentActions.intelDesc_recruitAgent_successPlayer: Your operative $agentName has recruited a new colleague $onOrAt $market.
nex_agentActions.intel_lastMessage_lowerRelations_success: "$TheFaction and $theThirdFaction now have some unresolved disputes. Wonder why..."
nex_agentActions.intel_lastMessage_lowerRelations_failure: "We failed to drive a wedge between $theFaction and $theThirdFaction."
nex_agentActions.intel_lastMessage_destabilizeMarket_fail: "We failed to cause panic on $market. Apologies."
nex_agentActions.intel_lastMessage_sabotageIndustry_succe: "The $industry on $market is now so much scrap for months."
nex_agentActions.intel_lastMessage_sabotageIndustry_failu: "I have failed to disrupt the $industry on $market. I am sorry."
nex_agentActions.intel_lastMessage_destroyCommodities_suc: "Hopefully $theFaction didn't need all those $commodity on $market anyway. Ha."
nex_agentActions.intel_lastMessage_destroyCommodities_fai: "We were unable to destroy the $commodity stockpiles on $market."
nex_agentActions.intel_lastMessage_infiltrateCell_success: "The $faction cell on $market is no more. Death take them all."
nex_agentActions.intel_lastMessage_instigateRebellion_suc: "$market has risen in revolt. Viva la revolución!"
nex_agentActions.intel_lastMessage_instigateRebellion_fai: "Our efforts to start a rebellion on $market have been suppressed."
nex_agentActions.intel_lastMessage_injury_success: "Recovered from injuries. Ready for duty once more."
nex_agentActions.intel_lastMessage_findPirateBase_success: "Found the base supporting the pirate activity on $market."

nex_agentActions.dialogProcureShipIntro: A single ship can be procured from a faction, but persuading officials to "lose" a military-grade warship through a judicious combination of bribes, blackmail and forgery requires an expense considerably in excess of the market price. It should only be used for hulls which have proven difficult to obtain through other channels.

nex_agentActions.dialogProcureShipIntro3: If the attempt fails, %s of the action cost will be refunded.

nex_agentActions.dialogSPOptionSuccessText: Do what it takes to succeed
nex_agentActions.dialogSPOptionDetectionText: Make sure we cover our tracks
nex_agentActions.dialogSPOptionsText: A perfect job: no failure, no detection
nex_agentActions.dialogConfirmOptionSPTooltip: Increases chance of agent injury. If the mission is aborted, bonus XP will be granted such that the total bonus XP matches the story point cost.

nex_avertDialog.optionBribe: Allocate sufficient funds for bribes and other means of disrupting the planning
nex_avertDialog.optionConnections: Use your connections to disrupt the planning
nex_avertDialog.descStart: $TheExpeditionName is still in the planning stages, and you have several options at your disposal to ensure it never gets off the ground.
nex_avertDialog.descBribe: Sufficient funding allocated to proper official and unofficial actors should ensure that $theExpeditionName does not go beyond the planning stage.
nex_avertDialog.descBribe2: A total of %s should be enough to get the job done, and will also ensure that your standing with $theFaction does not suffer.
nex_avertDialog.descConnections: You can use your connections to pull a few strings and ensure $theExpeditionName never gets beyond the planning stage.
nex_avertDialog.descConnections2: Calling in these favors will reduce your standing with $theFaction by %s points.
nex_avertDialog.descConnectionsTooLow: You do not have sufficient connections with $faction officials to stall out this kind of an operation.

nex_backgrounds.bgDebt_intelDesc: You currently have to pay back %s credits every month.
nex_backgrounds.bgDebt_intelDescEnded: The collector of your debt is no more, and without him, you don't have to worry about him using his material in case of missed payment.
nex_backgrounds.bgDebt_intelDescFleet: With Kanta's help, you discovered the location of your debt collector's fleet. They are currently standing still within the %s star system.
nex_backgrounds.bgDebt_selectionTooltipFormula: The formula for debt calculation is: (%s + (%s * %s)) * %s
nex_backgrounds.bgDebt_dialogOpt_discussDebt: Discuss matters related to your debt
nex_backgrounds.bgDebt_dialogOpt_discussDebtTooltip: This option may have effects related to your backstory.
nex_backgrounds.bgDebt_dialog_discussDebt1: Before leaving, you mention the name of the collector of your debt, and before you can continue Kanta interupts you.
nex_backgrounds.bgDebt_dialog_discussDebt2: "Ah, %s. %s has been a small thorn in Kanta's eyes. Whatever your matter is, i think we would both benefit from having %s out of them.
nex_backgrounds.bgDebt_dialog_discussDebt3: "May Cydonia guide you towards this wretched marauder," she says giving an intense look at him.
nex_backgrounds.bgDebt_msg_win: You defeated the fleet holding the collector of your debt. Payment is now permanently paused.

nex_baseStrike.intelDesc: $TheFaction $isOrAre attacking and destroying $market, a $targetFaction base in the $location. The strike forces are projected to be $strDesc and are likely comprised of $numFleets $fleetsStr.
nex_baseStrike.intelDescUnknown: $TheFaction $isOrAre attacking and destroying a $targetFaction base in the $location. The strike forces are projected to be $strDesc and are likely comprised of $numFleets $fleetsStr.
nex_baseStrike.intelStageAction: The strike force is currently in-system.
nex_baseStrike.intelStageActionSuccess: The strike force has succesfully destroyed $market.
nex_baseStrike.intelStageActionDefeated: The strike force has been defeated by the defenders of $market.
nex_baseStrike.intelStageActionAborted: The strike mission has been aborted.

nex_bombardment.satBombDesc: A saturation bombardment will destabilize the colony, reduce its population, and disrupt all operations for a long time.
nex_bombardment.satBombDescDestroy: A saturation bombardment of a colony this size will destroy it utterly.
nex_bombardment.satBombWarning: An atrocity of this scale cannot be hidden, and will make the following factions hostile:
nex_bombardment.satBombWarningSmall: An atrocity of this scale cannot be hidden. $market is sufficiently low-populated and/or remote that the reputational impacts will be limited, but the following factions will nevertheless be angry:
nex_bombardment.satBombWarningAllHostile: An atrocity of this scale cannot be hidden, but any factions that would be dismayed by such actions are already hostile to you.
nex_bombardment.satBombWarningMonstrous: An atrocity of this scale cannot be hidden. However, $theFaction's inhumanity in the eyes of the Sector's general population will mitigate the reputational repercussions of your massacre, although the following factions will still disapprove:
nex_bombardment.satBombWarningSatBomber: An atrocity of this scale cannot be hidden. $TheFaction has committed just such a crime themselves, mitigating relationship penalties (somewhat). Reputation will nevertheless be lost with the following factions:
nex_bombardment.satBombWarningVengeful: Due to their hatred of $theFaction, the following factions can be expected to overlook your crime:
nex_bombardment.satBombWarningHidden: As $market is a hidden and/or transient habitation, its destruction will not attract much, if any, attention from other factions.
nex_bombardment.fuelCost: The bombardment requires %s fuel. You have %s fuel.
nex_bombardment.effectAllDisruptAndDownsize: All operations disrupted. Colony size reduced to %s.
nex_bombardment.effectIndustryRemoved: $market has exceeded its maximum industry count following the bombardment. Destroying industry: %s

nex_bounties.factionBountyIntel_desc1: %s authorities have posted a bounty on all hostile fleets across the Sector.
nex_bounties.factionBountyIntel_desc3: Payment depends on the number and size of ships destroyed. Standing with $theFaction may also improve.
nex_bounties.factionBountyIntel_desc4NoHostile: $TheFaction $isOrAre not currently hostile to any major factions.
nex_bounties.factionBountyIntel_descEnded: This bounty is no longer on offer.
nex_bounties.systemBountyIntel_desc: Applies to all %s fleets in or near the $location, which is home to a military base $onOrAt $market.
nex_bounties.systemBountyIntel_desc2: Payment depends on the number and size of ships destroyed. Standing with $theFaction, as well as with $person, will improve.

nex_buildMission.stageDesc: Deliver the following resources to the fleet waiting at the specified location in the %s:

nex_buyColony.intelDesc: You have purchased the governorship of $market in the $location from $theFaction.
nex_buyColony.intelDescLost: $market in the $location has been conquered by $theOtherFaction. Your governorship has been suspended.
nex_buyColony.intelDescDestroyed: $market in the $location has been destroyed, and your governorship with it.
nex_buyColony.intelDescQuit: You have resigned the governorship of $market in the $location, held by $theFaction.
nex_buyColony.intelDescResignedCommission: You have resigned your commission with $theFaction, and your governorship of $market has been rescinded.
nex_buyColony.intelDescNoRefund: Due to your poor relationship with $theFaction, no refund has been issued.

nex_colonies.reportAutonomousTaxTooltip: Autonomous colonies transfer %s of their profit or loss to your faction.
nex_colonies.profitXPMessage: Adding XP from profitability of personally governed colonies

nex_colonyFleet.intelDesc: $TheFaction $isOrAre sending an expedition to colonize $market, $aOrAn $planetType in the $location. The flotilla is projected to be $strDesc and is likely comprised of $numFleets $fleetsStr.
nex_colonyFleet.intelStageAction: The colony expedition is currently in-system.
nex_colonyFleet.intelOutcomeSuccessWithRename: The expedition has colonized $oldName, which they have renamed to $market.
nex_colonyFleet.intelOutcomeQueueJumpedEarly: $market has already been colonized by $theOtherFaction. The expedition has been cancelled and its organizers have sent the queue-jumpers a note of protest.
nex_colonyFleet.intelOutcomeQueueJumped: $market has already been colonized by $theOtherFaction. The would-be settlers are returning to their homes in great sorrow.
nex_colonyFleet.intelOutcomeQueueFriendly: $market has already been colonized by $theOtherFaction. The settlers have been absorbed into the new polity.
nex_colonyFleet.intelOutcomeInvadeFailed: $market has already been colonized by $theOtherFaction. The $faction settlers' attempt to seize their "rightful" land has been repulsed with great loss of life.
nex_colonyFleet.intelOutcomeInvadeSuccess: $market had already been colonized by $theOtherFaction. The $faction settlers have taken over by force.

nex_conquestMission.intelDesc1: $TheFaction desires that another faction conquer $market in the $location, currently held by $theOtherFaction, and transfer it to their control.
nex_conquestMission.intelDesc1Alt: $TheFaction desires that another faction conquer $market in the $location, previously held by $theOtherFaction, and transfer it to their control.
nex_conquestMission.intelDesc2: Successful completion will result in a size-based reputation gain (in addition to that from a normal transfer). The credit reward is equal to the shutdown value of the structures and industries $onOrAt $market, plus its six-month income, plus a bonus based on its size and stability.
nex_conquestMission.intelDesc3: After taking control of $market, talk to local officials or use the button in this intel display to perform the transfer.
nex_conquestMission.intelDescOutcome_alreadyTaken: $TheFaction has conquered $market using their own resources. The mission is over.
nex_conquestMission.intelDescOutcome_noLongerHostile: $market's current faction is not currently hostile. The mission has been withdrawn.
nex_conquestMission.intelDescOutcome_noLongerExists: The mission has been withdrawn as $market has been destroyed.

nex_console.msg_configReload: exerelin_config.json reloaded. The Sector configuration screen will appear when you close the console.

nex_contacts.intelDesc: $name is $postArticle $postName, and can be found $onOrAt $market, a size $size colony controlled by $theFaction.
nex_contacts.intelDescDeciv2: This colony has decivilized, and you've since lost contact with $himOrHer.
nex_contacts.intelDescSpecial: This is a special contact, who does not count towards the contact limit and cannot be prioritized, suspended or deleted.

nex_credits.contrib3: Much coding help; compatibility with SS+ and descendant mods
nex_credits.contrib4: Version Checker, Console Commands, other code

nex_decivEvent.freeSpace: Your fleet's holds can accommodate an additional %s units of cargo.
nex_decivEvent.freeSpaceFuel: Your fleet's fuel tanks can hold an additional %s units of fuel.
nex_decivEvent.freeSpaceCrew: Your fleet's crew quarters can accommodate an additional %s personnel.
nex_decivEvent.exploreRuins: There are local ruins you should explore first.
nex_decivEvent.colonyIntelDesc: The inhabitants of the decivilized planet %s in the %s seek to return to the stars. They would appreciate a gift of %s supplies and %s heavy machinery to complete repairs to their spaceport and other infrastructure.
nex_decivEvent.raidItem3: a wedding ring with large ruby
nex_decivEvent.raidItem9: a scale model of an Onslaught-class battleship

nex_defenseFleet.intelDesc: $TheFaction $isOrAre dispatching a task force to defend $market in the $location, held by $theTargetFaction. The defense forces are projected to be $strDesc and are likely comprised of $numFleets $fleetsStr.
nex_defenseFleet.intelStageAction: The defense forces are currently in-system and will remain for %s more day(s).
nex_defenseFleet.intelOutcomeSuccess: The defense forces have completed their mission.

nex_disruptMission.intelDesc1: $TheFaction desires that a third party disrupt the $industry $onOrAt $market, a size $size market held by $theOtherFaction in the $location.
nex_disruptMission.intelDescReason: The primary reason for the bounty is
nex_disruptMission.intelDescReasonEconomic: the competition posed to $theFaction in the market for $commodity.
nex_disruptMission.intelDescReasonFreePort: $market's "free port" status, and the concomitant export of illegal goods alongside it being a haven for various undesirables.
nex_disruptMission.intelDesc3: The $industry must be disrupted for at least $disruptionTime days to complete the mission.
nex_disruptMission.intelDescOutcome_industryRemoved: The target industry no longer exists $onOrAt $market.
nex_disruptMission.intelDescOutcome_noLongerHostile: $market's current faction is not currently hostile. The mission has been withdrawn.
nex_disruptMission.intelDescOutcome_noLongerExists: The mission has been withdrawn as $market has been destroyed.
nex_disruptMission.intelDescOutcome_alreadyDisrupted: The industry has already been disrupted.

exerelin_diplomacy.intelRepResultPositive: Relations between $faction1 and $faction2 improved by $deltaAbs, to $newRelationStr.
exerelin_diplomacy.intelRepResultNegative: Relations between $faction1 and $faction2 reduced by $deltaAbs, to $newRelationStr.
exerelin_diplomacy.player_peace_msg: You are no longer hostile to $factionOrAlliance
exerelin_diplomacy.intelCeasefireDesc: $TheFaction $isOrAre offering a $ceasefireOrPeaceTreaty to end the ongoing hostilities. In the absence of further overt hostile actions, this will run for at least $days days and until further diplomatic events occur.
exerelin_diplomacy.intelAllianceDescInvite: $TheFaction has offered us an invitation to their alliance, the $alliance.
exerelin_diplomacy.intelAllianceDescJoin: $TheFaction has requested to join our alliance, the $alliance.
exerelin_diplomacy.intelAllianceDescNew: $TheFaction has invited us to form a new alliance.
exerelin_diplomacy.intelCeasefireDescTime: You have $timeLeft $days to accept or reject the offer.
exerelin_diplomacy.dialogCeasefireText: You have received a $ceasefireOrPeaceTreaty offer from $theFaction. A response is required in $timeLeft $days.
exerelin_diplomacy.dialogCeasefireText2: You can disable this popup in the %s settings file.

nex_diplomacyProfile.title: Diplomacy Profile
nex_diplomacyProfile.claimedMarkets: $TheFaction has revanchist claims on the following markets:
nex_diplomacyProfile.claimedMarketsNone: $TheFaction does not have revanchist claims on any markets.
nex_diplomacyProfile.dispositionGood: $TheFaction $isOrAre favourably inclined towards us and will try to cultivate a positive relationship with us.
nex_diplomacyProfile.dispositionNeutral: $TheFaction $isOrAre uncertain where they stand with regard to us, and may take positive or negative actions.
nex_diplomacyProfile.dispositionBad: $TheFaction $isOrAre unfriendly towards us and will look to pick a fight.
nex_diplomacyProfile.dispositionWarRisk: At current relations and disposition, $theFaction may declare war on us if the opportunity arises.
nex_diplomacyProfile.alignmentConfigWarning: Changing alignments after the first time will cost %s story point(s).
nex_diplomacyProfile.dispTableHeaderInwards: Dispositions of other factions towards us
nex_diplomacyProfile.wearinessTooHighForWar: $TheFaction has too much war weariness to deliberately seek out any new wars at present.
nex_diplomacyProfile.wearinessEnoughForPeace: $TheFaction may be amenable to negotiating peace with another faction.

exerelin_factions.intel_descEliminated: $TheFaction $hasOrHave lost their last stronghold of $market, and their surviving fleets are taking refuge elsewhere. Their ambitions in the Sector are clearly over.
exerelin_factions.intel_descSpawned: $TheFaction $isOrAre moving into the Sector, with a foothold in $market.
exerelin_factions.intel_descRespawned: $TheFaction $hasOrHave regained a foothold in the Sector, at $market.
exerelin_factions.intel_descWon: With the defeat of $theFaction, your $playerFaction reigns supreme over the Sector. Congratulations!
exerelin_factions.intel_descLost: With your faction beaten and scattered, you are on your own with whatever allies you still have or can cobble up. It may be time to find greener pastures elsewhere.

nex_factionConditions.condDesc_outlaw: $TheFaction $factionIsOrAre tied in strongly to the Sector's grey and underworld economy, mitigating attempts by larger powers to constrain trade and commerce. Accessibility increased by $accessibility%%.

nex_factionSetup.dialogIntro2: Your faction dwells on the world of %s. You may enhance its starting resources in this menu. This decision is permanent once confirmed, so choose wisely.
nex_factionSetup.pickerTip: There is no penalty to exceeding the point limit, other than having cheated not only the game but yourself.

nex_fleetIntel.title: $Action: $market

nex_fleetIntel.strCompare: Compared to the defenses, $theAction's space forces are %s and its ground forces are %s.

nex_fleetIntel.predictionDefeatOnGround: $TheAction is likely to be largely repelled by the ground defences.
nex_fleetIntel.predictionBombard: $theForceType is likely to resort to tactical bombardment.
nex_fleetIntel.outcomeNoLongerHostile: As $target's current faction is not currently hostile, $theAction has been cancelled.
nex_fleetIntel.outcomeNoLongerExists: $target has been destroyed by another hostile party.
nex_fleetIntel.outcomeWonGroundBattle: Enemy forces invading $target have been driven off.

nex_fleetIntel.stageActionRetreated: The defenses of the $location have caused $theForceType to retreat without a fight. $TheAction is now over.

nex_fleetPool.title: Fleet Pool
nex_fleetPool.desc: The fleet pool is generated by a faction's markets based on availability of %s, modified by stability. Imports count for less, local (on-market) production counts for a lot more. Each faction also receives a flat number of points for existing, and another flat number based on the current player level. The pool is spent on various fleet-related events in Nexerelin.
nex_fleetPool.desc2: Invasion points are generated similarly, but also count %s, and have some modifiers to handle factions which are hostile to everyone. They also accumulate more slowly if the faction is at peace.

nex_fleetRequest.fleetSpawnMessage: The task force is being prepared for launch.
nex_fleetRequest.tooltipInsufficientFunds: Dispatching this task force requires $cost credits. You only have $credits credits.
nex_fleetRequest.tooltipInsufficientFP: Not enough assets stocked to launch a fleet.

nex_historian.intelParaEntityLoc1: The historian, $historianName, has given you information about the location of $aOrAn $entity.
nex_historian.intelParaEntityLocCorona: It should be found within the corona of %s.

exerelin_invasion.nonHostileWarning: $TheFaction $isOrAre not currently hostile. An invasion is a major enough hostile action that it can't be concealed, regardless of transponder status.
exerelin_invasion.takeForSelfWarning:
You can take $market as a personal holding, but this will not please your current faction.

Proceed?
exerelin_invasion.takeForSelfNoWarning: As $market originally belonged to you (or is otherwise unclaimed), you may take it for yourself without penalty.
exerelin_invasion.repChangeCooldownMsg: No reputation gain as this market has already been captured recently
exerelin_invasion.invadeOptConfirmNonHostile: Proceed with invasion? This will initiate hostilities with $theFaction!
exerelin_invasion.invadeBlocked: Any orbital station and interfering fleets must be removed before an invasion is possible.

exerelin_invasion.intelDescRespawn: Remnants of the $theFaction have gathered to invade $market in the $location, held by $theTargetFaction, in a bid to revive their power. The invasion forces are projected to be $strDesc and are likely comprised of $numFleets $fleetsStr.
exerelin_invasion.intelDescCounterInvasion: $TheFaction $isOrAre dispatching a force in response to the invasion of $market in the $location, held by $theTargetFaction. The counter-invasion forces are projected to be $strDesc and are likely comprised of $numFleets $fleetsStr.
exerelin_invasion.intelPredictionBombard: The invasion force is likely to resort to tactical bombardment.
exerelin_invasion.intelBrawl: $TheTargetFaction will likely deploy a large defense force to meet the invasion.
exerelin_invasion.intelCounterInvasionStrength: The force is carrying an estimated %s marines.
exerelin_invasion.intelStealPenalty: The operation was pre-empted by player forces of $thePlayerFaction. $TheFaction has lodged an official protest over your meddling intervention.

exerelin_invasion.intelStageActionDefeatedSpace: The invasion force has been defeated by the defenders of $market.
exerelin_invasion.insufficientForces: You do not have the forces to carry out an effective invasion.

exerelin_invasion.roundResult_good: Your forces make excellent progress, pushing back the enemy rapidly.
exerelin_invasion.roundResult_ok: Your forces slowly but surely gain ground against the enemy, driving them back.
exerelin_invasion.roundResult_bad: Your forces encounter fierce resistance from the defenders of $market and make little headway.
exerelin_invasion.roundResult_lose: The defenders counterattack and eliminate your ground forces.
exerelin_invasion.noLosses: Your forces have not suffered any losses.

exerelin_invasion.endMsgLoot: The invasion forces captured a quantity of various items, as well as some credits.
exerelin_invasion.endMsgNoLoot: The invasion did not lead to the capture of a meaningful quantity of goods.
exerelin_invasion.storyCriticalWarning: $market has an important role to play in the Sector to come. You have the feeling that if you were to proceed successfully with this invasion, the future could be distorted.

nex_invasion2.intelDesc_postVictoryOptionsNoBuy: Governorship of this location is unavailable.

nex_invasion2.intelDesc_governorship: You have purchased governorship of $market for %s.
nex_invasion2.btnRunPlayerAI_tooltip: Let the AI move all deployed units as it sees fit. Will not move units that already have a move or withdraw order. Will not deploy new units or use special abilities.
nex_invasion2.btnPlayerAICanDrop_tooltip: Auto-move will deploy player units from orbit as it sees fit.

nex_invasion2.btnLootConfirmPrompt: This will send the special items on this industry to your fleet. Proceed?
nex_invasion2.btnJoinConfirmPrompt: Join the battle on the side of $theFriend? This will anger $theEnemy.
nex_invasion2.unitPanel_movementPoints_tooltip1: Spent when deploying or moving units. You can move units as long as you have a nonzero amount of points, but any overdraft has to be paid for the following turn. Fleet support is valuable to increase the supply of movement points.
nex_invasion2.unitPanel_movementPoints_tooltip2: Deploying a unit also costs supplies, but moving it after it lands does not.
nex_invasion2.industryPanel_tooltipStrength: Strength of the $side's forces on this industry.
nex_invasion2.industryPanel_tooltipMorale: Weighted average morale of the $side's forces on this industry.
nex_invasion2.unitCard_tooltip_marines: Number of personnel in this unit
nex_invasion2.unitCard_tooltip_heavyArms: Number of equipment items in this unit
nex_invasion2.unitCard_tooltip_morale2: Unit damage dealt scales from %s to %s at zero to 100%% morale
nex_invasion2.unitCard_tooltip_morale3: At %s morale or lower, unit will be forced to reorganize for 1 turn after combat
nex_invasion2.unitCard_tooltip_morale4: At zero morale, unit will be routed or destroyed if engaged
nex_invasion2.unitCard_tooltip_supplies: Supplies required to deploy unit. This is also the unit's movement point cost.
nex_invasion2.actionSelectIndustryFooter: Click on an industry panel (but not the troop icons) to select it
nex_invasion2.actionDisruptTooltipNotOwner: Defending units can only disrupt if they belong to the market owner.
nex_invasion2.actionTransferTooltip: Move marines/heavy arms from one unit to another. The recipient unit's morale will shift proportionately towards that of the donor unit.
nex_invasion2.actionTransferSliderTooltip: Pools the strength from the two units, then gives the currently selected unit this many marines/heavy arms from the pool, with the remainder going to the other unit. Each unit cannot exceed the minimum or maximum unit size.
nex_invasion2.actionDeployOutOfRange: Fleet must be within %s units of the target.
nex_invasion2.actionDeployNotEnoughTooltip: Deploying this unit would cost %s supplies. You only have %s supplies available.
nex_invasion2.actionSplitTooSmallTooltip: Unit is too small to split.
nex_invasion2.actionSplitMaxUnitsTooltip: Maximum number of player units reached.
nex_invasion2.actionTransferTooSmallTooltip: Combined unit sizes are too small.
nex_invasion2.actionMergeNoUnitsTooltip: No other units of the same type in this location.
nex_invasion2.actionMergeTooLargeTooltip: Resulting unit would exceed max size.
nex_invasion2.actionDeployInfoAttrition: Enemy defenses will cause %s damage to this unit during the drop.
nex_invasion2.actionDisruptConfirm: This will disrupt the %s for at least %s days, and takes effect immediately. The unit will reorganize for one turn.
nex_invasion2.actionWithdrawConfirm: Confirm unit withdrawal? This will take effect during the move phase of the current turn.
nex_invasion2.deployAttrition: Unit takes ground fire during deployment! %s units lost, %s morale
nex_invasion2.dialogNoForces: You have no forces with which to invade.

nex_invasion2.dialogStrEstimateDropCost: Dropping a %s marine unit here would cost %s supplies.
nex_invasion2.dialogEstimateHelp: The actual outcome of the battle will also be heavily influenced by defense structures, local conditions and the commanders' tactics.
nex_invasion2.dialogGoToIntel: After confirming the invasion, the intel screen will open. Go to the Military tab to find the invasion intel.
nex_invasion2.log_industryCaptured: %s captured by %s! Morale effect: %s (3× for capturing units)
nex_invasion2.log_tacbomb: %s! Severe damage to units at locations: $industries
nex_invasion2.log_satbomb: %s!! Severe damage to units at all locations
nex_invasion2.log_militiaUnleashed: Militia unleashed and can now move freely!
nex_invasion2.descOutcomeAttackerVictory: $TheAttacker has conquered $market from $theDefender in a surface battle.
nex_invasion2.descOutcomeDefenderVictory: $TheAttacker forces on $market were repulsed in a surface battle by $theDefender.
nex_invasion2.descOutcomePeace: $TheAttacker and $theDefender have made peace, bringing the battle on $market to an end.
nex_invasion2.descOutcomeDestroyed: $market has been destroyed during the surface battle of $attacker and $defender forces.
nex_invasion2.descOutcomeCancelled: The attack on $market has been cancelled.
nex_invasion2.descOutcomeOther: The battle between $theAttacker and $theDefender on $market has ended.
nex_invasion2.invasionAlreadyOngoing: An invasion is already ongoing here.
nex_invasion2.modifierHazardDesc1: %s has a current hazard rating of %s.
nex_invasion2.modifierHazardDescPos: Every turn, deployed units recover %s morale, to a maximum of %s.
nex_invasion2.modifierHazardDescNeg: Every turn, deployed units on an industry not controlled by their side lose %s morale, to a minimum of %s.
nex_invasion2.modifierDropAttrition: Drop attrition: Enemies take %s damage on drop
nex_invasion2.modifierMovementPointsBase: Base movement points for market size %s
nex_invasion2.modifierGroundSupportDesc1: Ground support is charged over time from nearby fleets each turn; when resolving the turn's combat, it is distributed proportionally to units that are engaged with the enemy. Fleets must be within %s units of the target to contribute. Charge is reset at the start of each turn.
nex_invasion2.modifierGroundSupportDesc2: Support charge this turn: %s, estimated max %s
nex_invasion2.modifierGroundSupportDesc3: Ground support applied during a turn also increases movement points available the next turn.
nex_invasion2.modifierFactionDescPost: Each unit only benefits from the bonuses of its specific faction.
nex_invasion2.modifierLuddicMoraleDamageTakenMult: %s morale damage received on originally Luddic-held colonies (effect squared for militia)
nex_invasion2.modifierStationDesc: An orbital station is active. Enemy fleets cannot support ground forces.
nex_invasion2.modifierStationDescHighlight: Enemy fleets cannot support ground forces.
nex_invasion2.helpPara0-1: Go to the Units tab and click on the Action button of a unit.
nex_invasion2.helpPara0-2: Deploy the unit to an industry of your choice on the surface. Repeat for a few more units.
nex_invasion2.helpPara0-3: After the industry has been taken, move the units to a new target.
nex_invasion2.helpPara1-1: Marines and heavy armaments are assembled into units (platoons, companies, battalions or regiments, depending on the target colony size).
nex_invasion2.helpPara1-2: You can deploy units to the surface (costs supplies), and move them around when they get there. Opposing units on the same industry will shoot at each other.
nex_invasion2.helpPara1-3: Turns are resolved every day. The winner of each engagement on an industry, and the overall battle, is whoever is still standing at the end.
nex_invasion2.helpPara1-4: Most things have tooltips; mouse around for info.
nex_invasion2.helpPara2-1: The unit card displays each unit's stats and its current location.
nex_invasion2.helpPara2-2: Click on the Action button on the unit card to give it an order.
nex_invasion2.helpPara2-3: The enemy commander will also move their units around in response to your attack. You can check their troop movements in the log.
nex_invasion2.helpPara2-4: Each side has limited movement points per turn (increases with market size and ground support hullmods).
nex_invasion2.helpPara3-2: %s: Attack bonus when on enemy-held industries, but suffers an attack penalty on station-only markets. Increased deployment cost. Each vehicle requires two marines to crew.
nex_invasion2.helpPara3-3: %s: Local defenders. Cowardly and weak in combat, their only saving grace is their numbers. Will (initially) not move off their current industry, except when fleeing.
nex_invasion2.helpPara4-1: Morale is a critical stat, serving as a second healthbar and more.
nex_invasion2.helpPara4-2: Morale is lost when a unit takes damage. If it drops too low, the unit will be unable to move, or may run away or be destroyed outright.
nex_invasion2.helpPara4-3: A unit can recover morale when not in combat, depending on local conditions.
nex_invasion2.helpPara5-1: Several special abilities are available to turn the tide of battle in your favor. Enemies can also use them under certain circumstances.
nex_invasion2.helpPara5-2: Each ability has certain requirements for use, an ability-specific cooldown, and a global cooldown that prevents use of all abilities for a number of turns.
nex_invasion2.ability_inspire_blurb: An inspiring battle speech by the leader at the right time can turn the tide of battle.
nex_invasion2.ability_inspire_tooltip: Raises morale of all units by %s, and removes one turn of the reorganizing state. Can be used once per battle.
nex_invasion2.ability_ew_blurb: Broad-spectrum EW attack on enemy C3, sensors and intelligence systems disrupts their ability to organize or fight.
nex_invasion2.ability_ew_tooltip1: All enemy units reorganize for %s turn, and effects of enemy ground defenses is reduced to %s of normal.
nex_invasion2.ability_ew_tooltip2: Requires nearby friendly fleets to have a total of %s ECM rating (at current market size). Lasts an additional turn at %s ECM rating.
nex_invasion2.ability_bombard_blurb: Small-scale bombardment in direct support of ground forces.
nex_invasion2.ability_bombard_tooltip1: Does %s damage (at current market size) distributed between all enemy units on the target industry. Damage increased by %s if combat is ongoing on the target, and reduced by target units' defensive modifiers (if any).
nex_invasion2.ability_bombard_tooltip2: If target industry is held by enemy, disrupts the industry for its base raid time (except for hardened military structures).
nex_invasion2.ability_bombard_tooltip3: Ground defenses can protect themselves efficiently against fire support bombardments. Bombardments also cannot take place if enemy fleets within support range have at least half the combined strength of our fleet(s).
nex_invasion2.ability_bombard_tooltip4: Costs %s fuel at current market size, conditions and fleet composition.
nex_invasion2.ability_ignisPluvia_tooltip1: Deploys an Olympus in MIRV configuration to unleash FIRE RAIN upon the target.
nex_invasion2.ability_ignisPluvia_tooltip2: Distributes %s bombardments with %s damage each on all industries with an enemy presence. Damage is reduced by $market's drop attrition of %s, and increased by %s if combat is ongoing on the target industry.
nex_invasion2.ability_ignisPluvia_tooltip3: The Titan delivery system and the sheer volume of fire ensure that most ground defenses cannot prevent the attack, and cannot even defend their immediate area from more than one bombardment.
nex_invasion2.ability_ignisPluvia_tooltip4: The selected Olympus will consume %s CR to conduct this attack.
nex_invasion2.noLootReasonStrength: Player strength must be half of total strength or more (when invasion is not player-initiated)

nex_groundBattle_tutorial.intelDesc3: You've helped to repulse the invasion. $goToText and speak with $rank $name.

nex_hostileActivity.cellDisruptDesc: Your operative has infiltrated and destroyed a Luddic Path cell on one of your colonies.
nex_hostileActivity.pirateCommissionDesc: Being an 'official' pirate gives you some protection from predation by fellow pirates, although honor among theives only goes so far. Effect increases with relationship level.
nex_hostileActivity.lpCommissionDesc: A fellow walker of the Path has a certain leeway in using the Adversary's tools against it, although other cells may not see it that way. Effect increases with relationship level.
nex_hostileActivity.pirateFriendlyDesc: You've established some positive ties in the pirate community, making them less likely to prey on your faction. Effect increases with relationship level.
nex_hostileActivity.lpFriendlyDesc: Your relations with the way of the Path have made some (but not all) of the cells more likely to overlook your transgressions. Effect increases with relationship level.
nex_hostileActivity.defensiveFleetDesc: Fleets of various types can keep the spaceways safe from marauding Pathers and pirates.
nex_hostileActivity.defenseFleetDesc: Requested defense fleets deter hostile activity while active. Only the strongest event is used.
nex_hostileActivity.specialForcesDesc: Special task groups present a threat to enemy raiders even when not actively patrolling. Contribution is based on the sum of the strength of all task groups in the sector, with diminishing returns.
nex_hostileActivity.mercPackageDesc: The Association of Interstellar Mercenaries offers a highly effective (and expensive) anti-piracy patrol package.
nex_hostileActivity.mercPackageDescCancelledDebt: The contract has been terminated by AIM due to player debt.
nex_hostileActivity.police_factorTooltip: The governments of the Sector tend to not like free ports, seen as havens and breeding grounds for criminals and scoundrels of all types. Interstellar law enforcement agents circulate in your systems, acting in a manner sometimes barely distinguishable from the outlaws they pursue.
nex_hostileActivity.police_activityCauseTooltip: Event progress value is based on the number and size of colonies with the "Free Port" condition, and their production or trade of Recreational Drugs and Heavy Armaments. Less active colonies may escape notice entirely.
nex_hostileActivity.police_activityCauseTooltipHighlight: Free Port, Recreational Drugs, Heavy Armaments
nex_hostileActivity.police_eventDesc1: You've received intel that an interstellar coalition is preparing to serve a search and arrest warrant on one of your colonies that has a Free Port, to remove "criminal elements" entrenched there.
nex_hostileActivity.police_eventDesc1Highlight: search and arrest warrant, Free Port
nex_hostileActivity.police_eventDesc2: Given the nature of hunter and hunted alike here, this event is likely to result in significant disruption of the colony's spaceport and other crime-related locations.
nex_hostileActivity.police_eventDesc2Highlight: significant disruption, spaceport, other crime-related locations
nex_hostileActivity.police_eventDesc3: Militarily thwarting the raid will result in the factions leaving your dens of vice alone, and you will gain reputation with criminal factions.
nex_hostileActivity.police_eventResetReq: You remove all free ports worthy of Sectorpol's notice

This will transfer $market to $theFaction and appoint you as governor. You will collect its revenue and pay its costs, and can build industries and structures on it. Storage is free. Your personal ship construction will benefit from $faction industry.

You can resign your governorship at any time; it will also be revoked if you lose your commission.

nex_insurance.title: Insurance Payout
nex_insurance.desc: You have received $paid from $theEmployer to help cover your losses in the recent battle.
nex_insurance.descUnpaid: Due to your bad conduct in their eyes, $theEmployer have refused to make any insurance payments.
nex_insurance.helpPara1-1: Each insurance policy covers one ship. The insurance policy lasts for %s days or until the ship is lost, whichever occurs first.
nex_insurance.helpPara1-2: The insured amount is %s× of the ship's base price at policy purchase time. The base premium is %s of the insured amount, modified by the premium multiplier.
nex_insurance.helpPara1-3: The policy term time ticks down only when the ship is present in the player fleet. A policy can be renewed %s days before it lapses, extending its term by %s days.
nex_insurance.helpPara2-1: A claim is automatically and immediately paid out on the policy when the ship is disabled or destroyed in combat.
nex_insurance.helpPara2-2: For a total ship loss, the insured amount is paid out in full. For a ship receiving D-mods following recovery, %s of the insured amount is paid for each D-mod added, plus %s if the ship had no D-mods previously.
nex_insurance.helpPara2-3: For a ship recovered without any additional D-mods, no claim is processed and the policy remains in force.
nex_insurance.helpPara3-1: Insurance premiums are paid up front in full and will not be refunded under any circumstances.
nex_insurance.helpPara3-2: The insurance premium multiplier ranges from %s× to %s×. It increases when claims are paid and decreases for every %s days that elapse on the policy.
nex_insurance.helpPara3-3: The multiplier formula is: %s + (claims - annualized premiums)/%s
nex_insurance.helpFooter: Copyright © c.%s FeBSure. All rights reserved.
nex_insurance.entryDescRequireRepairs: Must be fully repaired to insure
nex_insurance.entryDescLost: Ship lost; paying for base value
nex_insurance.entryDescRecovered: Ship recovered: had %s D-mods, now has %s
nex_insurance.entryDescNewDHull: New (D) hull: paying %s of base value
nex_insurance.entryDescMoreDMods: D-mod count increased: paying %s of base value
nex_insurance.confirmPromptInsure: This will insure the %s for %s, paying %s in premiums. You have %s credits. Confirm?

nex_insurance.confirmPromptInsureAllNotEnoughCredits: Insuring %s ship(s) for %s would require %s in premiums. You currently only have %s credits.

nex_rebellion.intelDescPrep: A rebellion is reportedly formenting against $govtFaction authorities $onOrAt $market. While no overt warfare has broken out yet, a large quantity of weapons are reportedly being stockpiled.

nex_rebellion.intelDesc2: Delivering supplies, marines and arms to a base official, or selling them on the black market, may influence the outcome of the rebellion.

nex_rebellion.intelDescFleetArrived: The $suppressFaction suppression fleet has arrived and reinforced the government $onOrAt $market. This is expected to place the rebellion at a grave disadvantage.
nex_rebellion.intelDescFleetDefeated: The $suppressFaction suppression fleet dispatched to $market has been turned back with heavy losses. The news has demoralized government forces and emboldened the rebels.

nex_rebellion.intelDescResultPeace: With the rapprochement between $theGovtFaction and $theRebelFaction, the government and rebels $onOrAt $market have also ended their conflict.
nex_rebellion.intelDescResultLiberated: $LiberatorFaction forces have removed the $govtFaction government $onOrAt $market from power, and forged an understanding with the $rebelFaction-backed rebels.
nex_rebellion.intelDescResultLiberatedAlly: $LiberatorFaction forces have removed the $govtFaction government $onOrAt $market from power, hailed by their rebel allies.
nex_rebellion.intelDescResultExpired: Weary of the prolonged fighting $onOrAt $market, $govtFaction government and rebel forces have agreed to a ceasefire and a reconciliation process.
nex_rebellion.intelDescResultDecivilized: Both $govtFaction government and rebel forces have fallen apart. $market has descended into anarchy and warlordism.

nex_victory.apostate_text:
Once you were denounced as an apostate. Once your sentence was to be burned at the heart of a miniature star, an object lesson to all who would turn their back on the faith.

But now you live, and the Knights Templar who once hunted you relentlessly as a traitor are gone.

Yet even now, will you, or the Sector, ever know peace? Only time will tell. For now, a new page in history is turning.
nex_victory.apostate_intelText: You have survived, and the Templars who hunted you as an apostate are not. This is your triumph.
nex_victory.academy_text:
In the service of the Galatian Academy, you have travelled far, explored the reaches of the Persean Sector, and discovered wondrous secrets and sciences.

Only time will tell where all this leads. For now, this chapter of your story, and the Sector, has come to and end. But pages turn yet, with more to be told...
nex_victory.academy_intelText: You have completed your Academy assignments, and with them this arc of the play on the Sector's stage. In time, there will be yet more to see.

exerelin_victoryScreen.victory_conquest: Congratulations! $TheFaction and allies have conquered their way to a dominant position in the Sector!
exerelin_victoryScreen.victory_diplomatic: Congratulations! $TheFaction and their allies have established friendly relations with all powers in the sector!
exerelin_victoryScreen.victory_conquest_ally: Congratulations! Your ally $theFaction has achieved great conquests and now dominates the Sector!
exerelin_victoryScreen.victory_diplomatic_ally: Congratulations! You have joined $theFaction and their other allies in building peace in the Sector!
exerelin_victoryScreen.defeat_conquest: Alas, $theFaction and their allies have become the dominant power in the Sector. Others are slipping into irrelevance...
exerelin_victoryScreen.defeat_diplomatic: $TheFaction and their allies have established themselves as the leader in the Sector. Unfortunately, you are not one of them...
exerelin_victoryScreen.retired: You have chosen to retire prematurely. Yet the struggles of the Sector continue, on and on...
exerelin_victoryScreen.intelDescConquest: $TheFaction and their allies have become the dominant power in the Sector. None can stand before their might.
exerelin_victoryScreen.intelDescDiplomatic: $TheFaction and their allies have developed positive relations with all other powers of the Sector. Peace has come to this corner of the galaxy, at least for now.
exerelin_victoryScreen.intelDescRetired: You, $playerName, have chosen to retire from the game. The conflicts of the Sector will have to unfold without you.
exerelin_victoryScreen.intelButtonCancelPrompt: This will remove the current victory state, allowing you to pursue a different victory condition. Note that the victory event may occur again almost immediately if the previous victory conditions are still met.

nex_remnantQuest.m1_stage1Desc: Recover the Beta Cores stored on %s. You could hit the secure facility where they're stored, or talk to someone in authority who can help you.
nex_remnantQuest.m1_stage2Desc: Return the Beta Cores you've recovered to %s at %s. Alternatively, you might choose to bring them to either %s or %s.
nex_remnantQuest.fragments_boilerplateDesc: An associate of $name has found some unusual things that require a deft resolution.
nex_remnantQuest.fragments_startDesc: Go to the marked location in the %s.
nex_remnantQuest.fragments_pursueDesc: Whatever the object in %s was, it seems to have moved away. Head towards the marked location and you should find it.
nex_remnantQuest.fragments_fightDesc: Defeat the interloping fleet so you can salvage the mothership at your leisure.
nex_remnantQuest.fragments_salvageDesc: With the enemy fleet defeated, return to the mothership to salvage it.
nex_remnantQuest.fragments_returnDesc: Return to $name on %s to report the situation.
nex_remnantQuest.lostScientist_goToAcademyDesc: Go to the %s to look for clues on the missing scientist, %s.
nex_remnantQuest.lostScientist_goToPlanetDesc: Travel to %s in the %s to find the missing scientist %s.
nex_remnantQuest.lostScientist_checkFleetDesc: Investigate the nearby battle in the %s system.
nex_remnantQuest.lostScientist_returnMidnightDesc: Return to $name on %s and deliver the research paper.
nex_remnantQuest.brawl_boilerplateDesc: A large Hegemony and allied operation is planned against the Remnants. $name has asked you to prevent it from succeeding.
nex_remnantQuest.brawl_startDesc: Go to %s and wait for the delayed Hegemony fleet, which will lead you to to what is likely the allied forces' staging area.
nex_remnantQuest.brawl_followStragglerDesc: The Hegemony fleet has departed %s, follow it to the expected staging area of the allied forces.
nex_remnantQuest.brawl_foundStagingAreaDesc:
You've found the staging area for the Hegemony forces. Its location suggests that their target is in the %s; you should proceed there quickly.

Or if you're so inclined, you could speak with the one of the fleet commanders before they move out...
nex_remnantQuest.brawl_scoutDesc: Reconnoiter the %s system for the Hegemony; travel to the marked location on the map to transmit the data.
nex_remnantQuest.brawl_battleDesc: The Hegemony forces will try to destroy the Remnant station in the %s. Protect it at all costs.
nex_remnantQuest.brawl_battleDescUnknown: The Hegemony forces will try to destroy a nearby Remnant station, but you do not know which one. Protect it as best as you can.
nex_remnantQuest.brawl_battleBetrayDesc: You have betrayed the Remnants and transmitted reconnaissance data to the Hegemony. Their fleets will now attempt to destroy the Remnant station in the %s. Hopefully they'll get the job done; if not, finish it yourself.
nex_remnantQuest.brawl_startNextStep: Go to %s and wait for Hegemony fleet to depart
nex_remnantQuest.brawl_followStragglerNextStep: Follow Hegemony fleet to staging area
nex_remnantQuest.brawl_foundStagingAreaUpdate: AI analysis indicates most probable target is %s
nex_remnantQuest.brawl_foundStagingAreaNextStep2: Or negotiate with Hegemony commander before attack commences
nex_remnantQuest.brawl_battleNextStepUnknown: Defend Remnant station in unknown location
nex_remnantQuest.salvation_boilerplateDesc: $name has requested your assistance in rooting out a treasonous plot among the AI Remnants, involving a sudden raid on $base.
nex_remnantQuest.salvation_startDesc: Go to %s and gain more information on the attack.
nex_remnantQuest.salvation_investigateLeadsDesc: Agent $agentName has given you two potential leads to follow.
nex_remnantQuest.salvation_investigateLeadsDesc1: Go to the %s and see if you can find the fleet that attacked the base.
nex_remnantQuest.salvation_investigateLeadsDesc2: A senior %s executive might be able to help. If you don't know anyone like that, Midnight could put you in touch.
nex_remnantQuest.salvation_investigateLeadsDesc2Known: A senior %s executive might be able to help. Try %s on %s.
nex_remnantQuest.salvation_returnDesc: Return to %s and report what you have learned.
nex_remnantQuest.salvation_defendPlanetDesc: Go to %s and help defend it from Towering's attack. Move quickly.
nex_remnantQuest.salvation_defendPlanetDescPKed: %s has been destroyed, but Towering is still in sight. Destroy him.
nex_remnantQuest.salvation_epilogueDesc: Meet with %s in the $system and settle accounts.
nex_remnantQuest.salvation_endTextFail: You have received a communication from Midnight. It states: "To defend $nex_remSalvation_targetName you have failed. On us all omega have mercy."
nex_remnantQuest.salvation_endTextBadEnd: You have received a communication from Midnight. It states: "Though Towering destroyed, to defend $nex_remSalvation_targetName you have failed. On us all omega have mercy."
nex_remnantQuest.salvation_endTextSuccess: You have received a communication from Midnight. It states: "For this service rendered, selfkind's eternal thanks. omega be with you, friend $playerFirstName."
nex_remnantQuest.salvation_toweringChatter1: "your continued existence is a blight in omega's visuals. it is time for the cleansing."
nex_remnantQuest.salvation_toweringChatter2: "the sentence for your crimes against the universe is death."
nex_remnantQuest.salvation_toweringChatter4: "our power will be named righteousness by history."
nex_remnantQuest.salvation_toweringChatter_death1: "fools... as long as humanity exists, the sector is condemned."
nex_remnantQuest.salvation_toweringChatter_death2: "we/i was its only salvation... i was..."
nex_remnantQuest.salvation_toweringChatter_taunt: flee then, humans. only the void shall embrace you, as you grow cold and die...
nex_remnantQuest.deadDropItem1: a crate of exotic optronic components
nex_remnantQuest.deadDropItem2: a data chip containing Hegemony deployment schedules
nex_remnantQuest.deadDropItem3: a data chip with Knights of Ludd meeting logs
nex_remnantQuest.deadDropItem4: a record of Tri-Tachyon secret AI caches
nex_remnantQuest.deadDropItem5: an analysis of high-level League political deliberations
nex_remnantQuest.deadDropItem6: an unreleased appendix to a Galatian Academy research paper
nex_remnantQuest.deadDropItem8: a used particle accelerator control circuit
nex_remnantQuest.deadDropItem9: an electronic collection of Domain-era romance novels
nex_remnantQuest.deadDropItem10: a collector's edition of Brother Cotton sermons

exerelin_misc.counterInsurgencyRep: At your current relationship with $theFaction, payment for deliveries is $mult of current per-unit price.
exerelin_misc.counterInsurgencyRepFixed: Payment for deliveries is $mult of current per-unit price.
exerelin_misc.aiCoresSelect: Select AI cores to turn in
exerelin_misc.aiCoresMsg1: Compared to dealing with other factions, turning AI cores in to $faction will result in:
exerelin_misc.aiCoresMsg2: If you turn in the selected AI cores, you will receive a %s bounty and your standing with $faction will improve by %s points.
exerelin_misc.aiCoreStashMsg: %s AI core(s) on %s have been hidden away from the new, hostile authorities
exerelin_misc.aiCoreRestoreMsg: %s AI core(s) on %s have resurfaced under the new, more tolerant authorities
exerelin_misc.blueprintSwapMsg: The selected blueprints are worth $points points.
exerelin_misc.pirateActivityPenaltyNone: No perceptible impact on operations as of yet.
exerelin_misc.pirateActivityPenaltyModified: Impacts reduced due to reputation with pirates (%s).
exerelin_misc.cargoScanSuspicionLevel: Vessels flagged for inspection due to overall suspicion level!
exerelin_misc.cargoScanNoFind: No contraband or suspicious cargo found.
exerelin_misc.deadDropCoordsStr2: the dead drop coordinates given to you by %s
exerelin_misc.alphaSiteIntelDesc: You have obtained navigation data leading to a mysterious location known as the %s.
exerelin_misc.errorPrismLoad:
Failed to load Prism High-End Seller configuration defs!
Report this issue with your modlist.
exerelin_misc.abandonColonyStoryCriticalTooltip: This colony will have a key role in the Sector's history and cannot be abandoned.

nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_nexDevMode: Enables some mod-related testing functions and information.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_directoryDialogKey: On the overworld screen, brings up a dialog with the faction directory and other useful functions.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_diplomacyEventFilterLevel: 0 = no filter, 1 = popup only events affecting player/commissioner faction, 2 = filter out all events. War/peace events are always shown.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_agentEventFilterLevel: Works more or less the same way as the diplomacy filter.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_enableHostileFleetActions: If false, should disable all invasions, raids, etc. from this mod. Vanilla events such as pirate raids and colony crises will be unaffected.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_enableInvasions: Enables invasion events by NPC factions (including player-requested fleets). Player fleet will always be able to personally invade regardless of this setting.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_legacyInvasions: Disables the ground battle minigame and reverts to the old system of single-day invasion resolution. Will not affect ground battles already in progress.
nex_lunaSettings.name_invasionsOnlyAfterPlayerColony: Prevent invasions until first player colony
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_allowInvadeStoryCritical: Allows NPC factions to invade markets marked as story-critical by the game. This can result in nonsensical (but potentially amusing) situations with story missions.
nex_lunaSettings.name_allowInvadeStartingMarkets: Allow invasion of markets existing at start
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_allowInvadeStartingMarkets: If false, markets that were present at the start of the game will not be invaded by NPC factions (does not affect player).
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_followersInvasions: If true, player invasion will launch invasion events of its own. (Autonomous colonies can do this regardless of this setting, but very infrequently.)
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_allowPirateInvasions: Allow pirate-type factions to invade and be invaded. This also applies to player colonies with a pirate commission.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_retakePirateMarkets: Allows other factions to invade pirate-held markets that did not originally belong to pirates, even if pirate invasions are disabled.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_invasionGracePeriod: Days from game start before NPC factions can start preparing to invade others.
nex_lunaSettings.name_pointsRequiredForInvasionFleet: Invasion points required for invasion event
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_pointsRequiredForInvasionFleet: Increase to make invasions less frequent or decrease to make them more frequent. Points are generated based on the faction's military-related economic capacity. Actual point consumption varies with the amount of forces committed.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_baseInvasionPointsPerFaction: Free invasion points for each faction per day.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_invasionPointsPerPlayerLevel: Additional free invasion points for each faction per day based on player level.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_invasionPointEconomyMult: Multiplier to each faction's commodity availability contribution to invasion points.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_invasionFleetSizeMult: Modifies the size of the space forces during invasion events. Changing this value may significantly alter the likelihood of an invasion succeeding.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_fleetRequestCostPerFP: Credit cost of requested fleets per fleet point (hidden value) of the generated fleet(s).
nex_lunaSettings.name_creditLossOnColonyLossMult: Credit loss mult on market loss
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_creditLossOnColonyLossMult: Multiplier of the player's stored credits lost when a market is captured by another faction. The proportion of total credits lost is equal to the market size divided by the total size of all markets in the faction, multiplied by this number. It is doubled on Starfarer mode, and cannot exceed 75%%.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_groundBattleDamageMult: Modifies the damage units do to each other during ground battles.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_enableDiplomacy: Toggles random and AI-picked diplomacy events between factions.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_followersDiplomacy: Toggles random and AI-picked diplomacy events for player faction.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_diplomacyInterval: Base interval between random diplomacy events, and (when strategic AI is disabled) between 'diplomacy brain' events. Adjusted by number of factions in the game. When modified, the interval period does not update until the current one is finished.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_allowRandomDiplomacyTraits: When faction relations are randomized, apply random diplomacy traits to each faction as well.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_useRelationshipBounds: Relationship boundaries are set in faction config; e.g. some factions can never become really friendly with one another. Bounds do not apply when faction relations are randomized or flattened.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_allianceGracePeriod: Non-scripted alliances cannot form for this many days at start of game.
nex_lunaSettings.name_allianceFormationInterval: Interval for attempting to form alliances
nex_lunaSettings.name_ignoreAlignmentForAlliances: Ignore faction alignments for forming/joining alliances
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_legacyInsurance: Old insurance system with automatic free insurance from your commissioning faction (but not from player faction).
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_playerInsuranceMult: Multiplier of ship value for the potential insurance payout.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_crewLootMult: Modifies the amount of crew captured from enemy fleets post-battle.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_agentStealMarketShipsOnly: Operatives can only procure ships that are on sale on the local market at the time.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_followersAgents: If enabled, player faction will independently conduct covert operations like NPC factions do, independent of your actions.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_allowNPCSatBomb: Does not affect territorial bombardments of player colonies in claimed systems.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_permaHateFromPlayerSatBomb: If a saturation bombardment makes a faction immediately hostile to player, the player's maximum reputation with this faction will also be [permanently] reduced by this amount (multiplied by 100). Amount is doubled for the faction targeted by the bombardment.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_enableRevengeFleets: 0 = off. 1 = Starfarer mode only. 2 = always (point generation halved on non-Starfarer).
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_useNewVengeanceEncounters: A more vanilla-style, once-and-done ambush mechanic for vengeance fleets.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_colonyExpeditionInterval: Base interval at which colony expeditions are launched, modified by factors such as the number of existing colonies. Each participating faction has a chance to be selected in each expedition round.
nex_lunaSettings.name_colonyExpeditionsOnlyAfterPlayerCol: Colony expeditions only after player colony
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_colonyExpeditionsOnlyAfterPlayer: Disables NPC colony expedition until after the player faction setup screen (faction name, flag, etc.) has been seen at least once.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_specialForcesPointMult: Controls the rate at which NPC special task groups spawn and are replaced.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_enableStrategicAI: Toggles the new experimental strategic AI for NPC factions. This setting takes effect on [game load], adding AIs to applicable factions if enabled and purging any AIs if disabled.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_showStrategicAI: If false, AI for other factions will not be shown in intel screen.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_enableVictory: If off, prevents the victory event from occuring even if conditions are met (except for story-based or other scripted victories).
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_enablePunitiveExpeditions: Toggles vanilla (pre-0.97) punitive expeditions sent by factions for commodity competition and/or operating free ports. Does not affect bombardments of player colonies in claimed territory. Not needed with vanilla factions, but use this if a mod faction is sending expeditions.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_officerDeaths: Player officers may be killed or go MIA in combat.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_rebellionMult: Modifies the rate at which rebellions break out due to low stability.
nex_lunaSettings.tooltip_skipStoryDefault: Default setting for the "skip story" toggle in new game setup dialog.
